name: rebuff
content:

to refuse to accept a helpful suggestion or offer from someone, often by answering in an unfriendly way: She rebuffed all suggestions that she should resign.

the act of refusing to accept a suggestion or offer from someone, often by answering in an unfriendly way: Her desperate request for help was met with a rebuff. The comments drew sharp rebuffs from budget experts in parliament.
More examplesFewer examplesThousands of voters deserted the party to deliver a stinging rebuff to the Government.He has twice been defeated in leadership contests and is reluctant to risk a further rebuff.She was stunned by the rebuff.
